title: [Feat]: Disable pressing "Enter" to send message
body:
### Describe the feature

For YEARS Teams has made the ENTER key the default "Send Message" action.  This leads to MANY inadvertant sends when the user really just wants a new line.

### Motivation

Some many times I just want a new line and get a send message.  Forget to just get a new line is SHIFT-ENTER.  Makes me feel SO STUPID to send partial messages.  Seems like in fine MS fashion - this issue has been discussed for YEARS without MS providing some parameter to all the user to determine what that user would like to have the "Enter" button do.

### Alternatives

Once in a message if you type CTRL-SHIFT-X puts you into "edit mode" and enter works as enter without send.   This works fine - and actually gives the user more formatting options.  But the user must remember to press CTRL-SHIFT-X EVERY time they enter a new message OR the result is pressing Enter sends message.

### Additional context

Could you make it that once the user positions their cursor into the text area for typing a message - your code behind the scenes detects the position of the users cursor - checks some user setting that you have provided - AND if the setting is "SendMessageOnEnter=N" - your code sends the CTRL-SHIFT-X key sequence to automatically put the message box in edit mode.  If the user setting is "SendMessageOnEnter=Y" - then the default "Enter-Send" would apply.
Would this be possible ???
BTW - I just hit ENTER a ton of times - AND - github does it right - my new feature request did not just post half way through my dissertation.  I actually have to click "Create" to post - What a concept MS !!! :-)
